measure.name: process_heating_setpoints
measure.display_name: Set Residential Heating Setpoints and Schedules
measure.description: This measure creates the heating season schedules and the heating setpoint schedules. See https://github.com/NREL/resstock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: This measure creates res heating season ruleset objects. Schedule values are either user-defined or populated based on information contained in the EPW file. This measure also creates res heating setpoint ruleset objects. Schedule values are populated based on information input by the user as well as contained in the res heating season. The heating setpoint schedules are added to the living zone's thermostat. The heating setpoint schedules are added to the living zone's thermostat. The heating setpoint schedule is constructed by taking the base setpoint (or 24-hour comma-separated heating schedule) and applying an optional offset, as specified by the offset magnitude and offset schedule. If specified as a 24-hour schedule, the base setpoint can incorporate setpoint schedule changes, but having a separately specified offset magnitude and schedule is convenient for parametric runs.

argument.name: weekday_setpoint
argument.description: Specify a single heating setpoint or a 24-hour comma-separated heating schedule for the weekdays.

argument.name: weekend_setpoint
argument.description: Specify a single heating setpoint or a 24-hour comma-separated heating schedule for the weekend.

argument.name: weekday_offset_magnitude
argument.description: Specify the magnitude of the heating setpoint offset for the weekdays, which will be applied during hours specified by the offset schedule. A positive offset increases the setpoint while a negative offset decreases the setpoint.

argument.name: weekend_offset_magnitude
argument.description: Specify the magnitude of the heating setpoint offset for the weekdays, which will be applied during hours specified by the offset schedule. A positive offset increases the setpoint while a negative offset decreases the setpoint.

argument.name: weekday_offset_schedule
argument.description: Specify a 24-hour comma-separated schedule of 0s and 1s for applying the offset on weekdays.

argument.name: weekend_offset_schedule
argument.description: Specify a 24-hour comma-separated schedule of 0s and 1s for applying the offset on weekend.

argument.name: use_auto_season
argument.description: Specifies whether to automatically define the heating season based on the weather file. If the cooling setpoint is less than the heating setpoint during the heating-only season, the cooling setpoint will be set to the heating setpoint. If the cooling setpoint is less than the heating setpoint during the overlap season, the heating and cooling setpoints will be set to their average value. User-defined heating season start/end months will be ignored if this is selected.

argument.name: season_start_month
argument.description: Start month of the heating season.

argument.name: season_end_month
argument.description: End month of the heating season.
